intro: Aganosma montana, commonly known as the mountain aganosma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
